byline.contributor: Anthony Shadid contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon, and Heba Afify from Cairo.

abstract: Col Muammar el-Qaddafi’s fall invigorates the Arab World but photographs of his bloody corpse are reminder of many still-unresolved conflicts that the Arab Spring has unleashed; Libyan activists say Qaddafi should have been tried and his crimes investigated; Libya's path to democracy, most tortuous of North African revolutions, faces many challenges, including need to balance vengeance against justice, and fidelity to Islam against tolerance for minorities.
snippet: Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi’s capture captivated the Arab world, but images of his bloody corpse were a reminder of the Arab Spring’s many still-unresolved conflicts.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi’s capture captivated the Arab world, but images of his bloody corpse were a reminder of the Arab Spring’s many still-unresolved conflicts.

headline.main: Qaddafi’s Death Places Focus on Arab Spring’s ‘Hard Road’
headline.print_headline: Fate of Dictator Places Focus On Arab Spring’s ‘Hard Road’
headline.seo: Qaddafi’s Bloody End Points to Difficulties Ahead
